Decaf Editor API

Uses of Class
org.hs.generator.GConstruct

Packages that use GConstruct
com.bitwise.decaf.editor This package contains the foundation of the Decaf editor, including all user interface components for code constructs up to but excluding the contents of method bodies (those are found in the grammar package). 
com.bitwise.decaf.editor.grammar This package contains the user interface foundation for the contents of method bodies. 
org.hs.generator This Java code generating package is designed for both static and dynamic (especially interactive) clients. 
 

Uses of GConstruct in com.bitwise.decaf.editor
 

Subclasses of GConstruct in com.bitwise.decaf.editor
static class Type.NoType
          A Type that represents a user interface state in which the user has neglected to set a type on a particular field, or has removed a type without replacing it.
static class Type.NullType
          A Type to represents the Java keyword null.
static class Type.VoidType
          A Type to represents the Java keyword void.

Uses of GConstruct in com.bitwise.decaf.editor.grammar
 

Subclasses of GConstruct in com.bitwise.decaf.editor.grammar
 class CodeNode
          CodeNode is the abstract base class for all nodes in the code tree under the DMethod.BodyGrammar.
 class Grammar
          Grammar is a secondary base class of CodeNode, representing both Phrase and Sentence.
 class Paragraph
           
 class Phrase
          Phrase is a transparent wrapper for a GExpression, holding its place in the code tree and providing a generic interface by which the editor can interact with it.
 class Sentence
          Sentence is a transparent wrapper for GStatement, holding its place in the code tree and providing a generic interface by which the editor can interact with it.

Methods in com.bitwise.decaf.editor.grammar with parameters of type GConstruct
 void GrammarMask.display(GConstruct code)
          Displays the description field that is inherent to every GConstruct.
 void GrammarMask.apply(GConstruct code)
          Applies the user's description entry to the current code construct.

 class GBinary
          GBinary represents an assortment of binary (i.e., two-sided) expressions which includes:
 class GBlock
          A GBlock represents {a block of code in braces}, separate from those blocks that are intrinsically attached to a loop or switch construct.
 class GBreak
          This class represents a break statement in the context of a conditional loop or switch statement.
 class GCast
          A type cast expression, consisting of an GExpression to cast and a GType to cast it to.
 class GCatch
          A catch clause of a try/catch/finally statement, consisting of a variable to catch and a block to execute under that condition.
 class GClass
          A class declaration.
 class GClassInit
          A class initializer block, which may be static.
 class GCode
          This class is kind of a cluge; it allows a block of text to be included in the GConstruct tree as a statement of Java code.
 class GComparison
          A boolean comparison between two values, consisting of two GExpression`s and one of the following operators:
 class GContinue
          A continue statement in the context of a conditional loop.
 class GFor
          This class represents a for loop such as:
 class GGroup
          An expression delimited by parentheses, such as:
 class GIf
          An if statement, comprised of the expected condition expression, thenClause and elseClause.
 class GInstanceOf
          An instanceof expression, comprised of the expression to evaluate, and the type against which to check it.
 class GInterface
          A reference to an interface by classname.
 class GLiteral
          A literal expression, explicitly typed by the field type, and encoded with a java.lang.String.
 class GLoop
          An abstract base class for conditional loops.
 class GMethod
          A method definition.
 class GMethodCall
          A method call expression or statement.
 class GNew
          An constructor invocation through the keyword 'new', by classname and optionally including a subclass definition (in the case of an anonymous instance creation).
 class GNewArray
          An instantiation of an array; empty (with dimensions), or initialized.
 class GReference
          JLS 6.5.2 Reclassification of Contextually Ambiguous Names
 class GReturn
          A return statement.
 class GSourceFile
          A source file, as expected by a standard Java compiler.

          A stepwise operator, one of:
 class GSwitch
          A switch statement, using GSwitchLabelGroup for case labels.
 class GSwitchLabelGroup
          A set of confluent case labels in a switch statement.
 class GSynchronized
          A synchronized statement.
 class GThrow
          A throw statement.
 class GTry
          A try/catch/finally statement.
 class GType
          A very convoluded representation of types.
 class GTypeDeclaration
          A type declaration; i.e., a class or interface, or an inner class or interface.
 class GUnary
          A unary operation, one of:
 class GVariable
          This chameleonic class can represent a local variable, a class field, a parameter, or one of the keywords this, super, class, length.
 class GVariableList
          A list of GVariables all declared in a single statement.
 class GWhile
          A while or do loop.
 

Fields in org.hs.generator declared as GConstruct

          The code to be executed under positive evaluation of the condition.
